alert.note: Alert for Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Seminole and south central Orange Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Avalon Park, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Altamonte Springs, Oviedo, Winter Springs and Winter Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
